definition: to withdraw/to pull back/to contract/to shrink/to reduce/abbreviation/also pr. [su4]
"silk" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 120), occurring in 红, 绿, 累 etc/also pr. [mi4]
to wither/to dry up (of a plant)/to atrophy (of muscle, social custom etc)
to concentrate (a liquid)/concentration/espresso coffee/abbr. for 意式濃縮咖啡|意式浓缩咖啡
(economics) to reduce/to curtail/to cut back/to tighten/austerity/tightening/crunch
to shrink (in the wash)/fig. to shrink (of profits etc)
to pull back/to shrink/to contract/(physiology) systole
miniature version of sth/microcosm/epitome/(Tw) to microfilm

sentences.english: The process of polyvinyl butyral (PVB)was briefly introduced.
sentences.chinese: 简述了聚乙烯醇缩丁醛生产的工艺流程。

sentences.english: Lipid layer of cuticle is a hydrophobic surface on which the anti felting resin can't deposit well.
sentences.chinese: 羊毛表面类脂结构的存在不利于防毡缩树脂的吸附。

sentences.english: The snail drew in its horns.
The frightened children were clustered together.
sentences.chinese: 受惊吓的小孩子们缩在一块。

sentences.english: If you sleep curled up, you are probably a very nervous person.
sentences.chinese: 如果你缩蜷身体而睡，则你很可能是个易紧张之人。

sentences.english: She recoiled at the sight of the snake.
Such a hierarchy may be expressed through special character sequences or indentation.
sentences.chinese: 这样的层次可以通过特殊的字符序列或者缩进来表示。

sentences.english: Just permit the dime that she so shrinks in the carriage, allow her to so wail.
sentences.chinese: 只是任她那么缩在马车的一角，任她那么哭着。

sentences.english: There was no depression of uterine activity during infusion period and second stage of labor.
sentences.chinese: 此后在连续输注及第二产程中无宫缩抑制现象。

sentences.english: Outside the wind was so I put my whole body shrinks up, teeth, but keep tremble.
sentences.chinese: 外面的风吹得我把全身缩了起来，牙齿却不停打颤。

sentences.english: The thumbnail will be scaled to a rectangle as large as possible inside a given rectangle, preserving the aspect ratio.
sentences.chinese: 缩图会依照原有的比例，尽可能缩放到指定的矩形中。

sentences.english: She clasped and unclasped her hands.
sentences.chinese: 她松开手，身子缩了回去。

sentences.english: She stared down at me and backed up, concerned but afraid.
sentences.chinese: 她向下凝视着我和猬缩，担心，但害怕。

sentences.english: The tank laboriously crawled on with a huddle of soldiers hanging behind.
sentences.chinese: 坦克吃力地爬行着，一堆士兵缩在后面跟着走。

sentences.english: The contraction may be applied to products of components, which have tensor character.
sentences.chinese: 缩并可以用于具有张量性质的分量之积。

sentences.english: Perched on a chair near her Christmas tree, Mrs McKamey could not help but cry.
sentences.chinese: 麦克康美太太缩在圣诞树旁的椅子里泣不成声。

definition: to tremble/to shiver/uncontrolled shaking of the body
to tremble/to shake out/to reveal/to make it in the world
to curl up shivering (from cold)/timid and trembling (in fear)/to shrink/to cower
to turn/to twist/to wring/to sprain/to swing one's hips
to curl up (like a scroll)/to huddle/Melania libertina/wriggle (as a worm)
